intro: Fuirena annua, commonly known as the annual fuirena, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and has slender, upright stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. Fuirena annua is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
